website_summaries.verdict: Performs a variety of gardening tasks, including digging through tough soil to plant bulbs.
pros: Not specifically a bulb planter, but an all-around garden tool with sharp edges that can be used to dig into tough soil to plant bulbs and seeds
Gardeners love that it also removes weeds, opens bags, cuts through roots and more
cons: You should also buy a safety sheath to store knife in

customer_reviews.title: Cheap tools don't last...
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed with this knife: the handle broke the first time I used it. The serrated cutting side was not sharp. I'm a professional landscaper so I should have known better than to buy an inexpensive tool. Amazon was great about returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Broke, poor weld, rust
customer_reviews.text: After letting my friends know about this awesome tool for weeding... i was using the garden knife to pull a weed and *SNAP* The handle broke right off. Inspection revealed that the1 spot weld used to hold everything together even had rust inside. POS
customer_reviews.author: GnarCal

customer_reviews.title: Broke right in half
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great for about 20 minutes getting weeds out with deep roots. Then the tool "guaranteed to not bend or break" bent right in half and broke into two much quicker than some of the cheaper ones it was meant to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M

customer_reviews.title: Theoretically a good knife with many functions for a gardener
customer_reviews.text: Theoretically a good knife with many functions for a gardener. Unfortunately the first time I used it it split in half because of the shoddy 1 spot weld. I got friend who teaches welding to put it back together again. Guess they don't teach good welding skills in China.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Jones

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is poor.  Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the most disappointing tool I’ve ever purchased from Friskars. This particular planting tool almost finished removing one dandelion before it snapped at the guard. It appears that instead of fabricating this tool with a full tang someone was convinced that sufficient strength could be achieved by tack welding the tang of the tool to the blade and guard assembly. They were incorrect. The was nearly no weld penetration into the hairs resulting in the weakest of mechanical bonds instead of a robust weld joint. In short this tool’s weld engineering is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Seawolf

customer_reviews.title: Carry it with me in my garden tool box!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to tool for my big yard. I sliced instead of edged my whole sidewalk where grass and soil was growing over and beyond the boundaries. I sit down and cut between the sidewalk and the soil, evenly, just like cake, doing a little at a time. I try to water the night before, that makes everything a bit easier. I dig up big weeds with it, last year's sunflowers, dead Hollyhocks, plant bulbs, it's great. Nice heavy construction, have not hurt myself but I don't loan it out, I tell them where I got it, it looks dangerous, but it's not. I'm 65, female, and a "sit-down" flower bed tender and gardener.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa V.

customer_reviews.title: How did I pull weeds before I had this tool?
customer_reviews.text: This little tool puts all other weeding tools to shame. I had been using a "garden" variety weeding tool for decades until our handyman let me use his Fiskars Garden Knife just this past spring. There was no comparison. This tool makes a perfect slit in the dirt and with one turn of your wrist, unearths the roots of the weed so you can pull it. Then the slit closes right back up. I had to have one of my own and I have been using it all summer. It makes such quick work of weeds. Seriously, if you have weeding to do, get one of these. You will thank me afterward. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Dayna L. DiRienzo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Junk
customer_reviews.text: I was originally very happy with my purchase as it seemed like a lot of tool for the money. But after only a few weeks of light use it broke. The blade itself seems fine, but it's not a solid piece of metal. The handle shaft is affixed to the blade and it's a week point... Just snapped with a little pressure being applied. For very light gardening, it's probably fine. But I was digging relics and coins while metal detecting and for that purpose this is no good. I see on here now a lot of reviews where owners had the same problem. I would have thought they would have redesigned it by now.
customer_reviews.author: Edward L. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: It's an economical and useful gardening tool
customer_reviews.text: This has a nice big handle and it’s easy for me to get a good grip on it. The knife itself is strong but light. I can saw my way through sod, cut small roots, and pick out weeds right down as deep as they go. It’s good for cutting through clay and soil that’s not too rocky - using it in gravelly soil I always get the feeling the blade is going to bend on me, but so far it never has. Overall, an economical and very handy gardening tool. Much more useful than the run-of-the-mill gardening trowels.
customer_reviews.author: EusebiusTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: It's not if, it's when...
customer_reviews.text: It finally snapped in half after 8-years of use, just like all the other reviewers experienced. That little weld attaching the blade and handle will break at some point. Other than that, it was a very useful too, and will be replaced with a sturdier tool. Fiskars designs its products with planned obsolescence, but that attribute isn't always obvious.
customer_reviews.author: borborygmus

customer_reviews.title: Depth,
customer_reviews.text: The handle is a bit too long for the right leverage in digging below the surface of a weed. A previous, similar product was a bit easier on the wrists. The cutting edge is good, and the deep sharp notch is effective in securing a root to lift or cut off. Best weeding tool I have found, and I have had many in 30 years of gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Crone

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: I have owned one of these for years. After lots of use it finally broke. I was so impressed with the old one I ordered two more. They are not built with the same quality as the older one. The new one broke with the very first weed I dug and I have very soft sandy soil. I was very upset and just threw it in the trash and put the other one in the shed, then ordered a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: daryl

customer_reviews.title: I really dig this garden knife...
customer_reviews.text: The first thing everyone said when they first held this and looked it over was "Wow, what a wicked tool". The combination of the forked tip, serrated edge etc... all very sharp. I finally got to play with this. I had to drive the plastic stake of a solar light into some tough ground. This tool went rather easily into the soil cutting roots as it went. X marked the spot, and I didn't have to worry about the stake breaking before it went deep enough. I'm looking forward to using this again. Delivery was quick. The very best part is the lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: A Southern Yankee

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, snapped in half second time we used it.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. We bought it back in June, used it once and put it away. My wife tried t use it again this week (3 months later) and it snapped right in half. Amazon't description pages says "lifetime warranty" but there sure doesn't seem to be a way to return it to them. We didn't keep the packaging - who would, so I guess we're out of luck. I always thought Fiskars was a name to trust. Not in this case.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Has held up over time and is one of the most used tools in my garden.
customer_reviews.text: A friend and I have two of these we use in our community garden plots. It may be the only tool we use every time we go out there to work. It has worked great for weeding around our plants as well as planting. The saw blade works well for small roots and the point does well for the thicker single root weeds. The other edge isn't sharp, but it still works well to use to scrap the weeds off the surface. We have owned these for either 3 or 4 years and they haven't shown any sign of damage or bending. I bought two more for each of us to keep at our houses.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Martin

customer_reviews.title: Handle breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: These things are horribly built. I love my other Fiskars products, but this thing is junk. I have had to warranty one already and second one broke within a day of use. I use mine to cut grass away from sprinkler heads or to dig out around them when i need to replace a head. Both times now they have broken between the handle and spade. Weak design. Too bad because the spade head is great for pretty much everything.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: The Hori Hori knife is expensive and I didn't know if I'd like it. The Fiskars Big Grip is very much like the Hori Hori ("dig dig") so I was willing to give it a try. We live in a red clay state so digging anywhere in our yard is difficult. I used the Big Grip today to loosen weeds from the soil. It worked like a charm. I also dug a few small holes to transplant some wayward plants. This product will be in several stocking this Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: NonnaB

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke the first time I was using it!
customer_reviews.text: Like so many other 1-star comments, this tool is junk. Handle broke the first time I used it. In looking at the "weld", it was rusty where the weld was made. I used to think that Fiskars was a quality name, but based on my experience and that of so many other reviews for this tool, I am no longer convinced that all Fiskars products are high quality. Returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cool

customer_reviews.title: Great for prying up crabgrass
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this knife. My wife accidentally threw the first one away and I didn't realize how good it was until I tried other knives. I use it to pry up crab grass in the lawn. The forked tip and thick blade does this with ease and the handle keeps my hand from sliding onto the blade. The only negative is that it can be bent if not careful. I do tend to bend it a little and have to flip it over and bend it back the other way. So far it's never broken.
customer_reviews.author: LeCreaux

customer_reviews.title: Decent tool although...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good tool, useful in it's own right. Not a super fan of how the handle tappers down ended wrapping it in duck tape to build up the handle for better grip. Probably wouldn't buy it again if it breaks. Not a super fan of the two large points at the end more of a hazard or deterrent in it's use. Not necessary with how they are. Used a grinding wheel to shave it down makes it more useful.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I like it for metal detecting, points are sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to add to my metal detecting gear. It is working well so far. I have used it mainly in dirt, the points are sharp and break through roots well. I have had a chance to use the serated edge a few times and it did well with a little sawing. Whether for metal detecting, gardening or whatever else you are looking at this for keep in mind that the points are sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for planting vegetable starts.
customer_reviews.text: Well made tool. Seems to be welded better than some of the other reviewers have stated. For the value price, I would consider it a homeowners grade tool as some Hori hori knifes can cost $70.00. It works very well and cuts rih ght through the weed mat and any roots below it.
customer_reviews.author: Honkykat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use garden knife
customer_reviews.text: This is my first garden knife, and it works like a dream! I have used it to divide perennials both in pots and from the garden bed without difficulty. This knife helped to make sure I was keeping the root system intact, which made transplanting much easier. The only dislike that I have is that it does not have a sheath, but has a plastic covering that it comes in. Otherwise, I love this gardening knife, although I don't have anything else to compare it to!
customer_reviews.author: Kuuipo Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Snapped in half at first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product a while ago and only just used it now--it broke with first use. Is there a way to return/replace? It claims to have a lifetime warranty. Clearly, I am now seeing that I am not the only one this has happened to and that there is a quality problem with the tool manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: olivekitty

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: The handle is attached by a few drops of glue. Upon inserting it into the ground, the handle snapped off. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice robust tool
customer_reviews.text: I know Fiskars usually makes a quality product, but I was really surprised how robust this tool is. I was expecting this to have a thinner stamped steel blade, but it has a really heavy blade that appears to have some sort of protective plating on it. It is a very rigid tool that feels nice in the hand and the handle is rubberized for a nice grip. I already used it to dig out weeds in my plant bed and it tears through the roots with little effort. I anticipate a long life out of this tool. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Browncoats Unite!Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Become a weed massacre machine
customer_reviews.text: When you pull weeds, do you want the other weeds to see you coming, daintily plucking out one weed at a time like some kind of sissy, and think "oh that Doesn't look so bad!" NO! You want those little bastards shaking in their roots! When I head out to the yard with this bad boy, the weeds know who's in charge. As I make my way through the rows STAB! STAB! STAB! I can practically smell the terror coming off those weeds, and I know they'll not be returning next year after seeing what I'm capable of.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Medium Duty
customer_reviews.text: Love the tool , but unfortunately the handle broke off of it as was digging out some weeds.. Fiskars did honor the warranty and sent me a replacement. But not having the tool for a week in prime gardening weather was unnecessary stress. I will be buying another brand as a back up and/or eventual replacement.
customer_reviews.author: househusband

customer_reviews.title: A versatile garden weeding tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite garden tool, especially for weeding. The sharp edge allows you to scrape across ground a get a swath if pesky small weeds all at once. The forked tip allows you to dig out bigger weeds and cut small roots. It has a big, comfy handle to give medium-size hands some leverage without wearing out tour grip. The one flaw is the lack of a sheath that many hori-style garden knives come with. I end up tossing it into a bucket or a cargo pants pocket between tasks.
customer_reviews.author: BradT KC

customer_reviews.title: Well...it works
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price..I use it for metal detecting cutting plugs in dirt to find targets,Ive been a bit hard on it and so far no complaints,I wouldnt abuse it like a high dollar digger,Ive hit rocks and pryed up rocks and so far so good..it no doubt has limits,if your going to be really hard in your use buy a better made tool..as for sheaths I had a british sheath for a knife and it fit,the detecting bag I have has a digger tool pouch so no sheath isnt a issue for me
customer_reviews.author: Rowley T. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: I like this tool
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool. I use for weeding. I use it groove side up, sticking it into the soil close to the offending weed. Then I lever the entire plant, root and all, up and out. I use this to also stab around a newly planted plant before watering, so the water goes right down around the roots. The tool is large. If you have tiny hands, I don't know if the tool would be suitable. But it is working well for me.
customer_reviews.author: sulymo

customer_reviews.title: Beware!! Broke at weld
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this item. I read reviews stating they broke but thought maybe it was just a fluke or improper use. Not so--It broke at the handle weld on my second use. I have contacted Fiskar for warranty. I hope they will send me a new one that is properly made.
customer_reviews.author: Cuda's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Solid garden tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Garden knife I bought for my wife, only because she lost the last one in the garden (no idea how). This is a sturdy working tool for digging up roots, cutting through roots, making holes for plants in the garden. As long as you clean it and oil it a bit for the winter, it should last a long time. Well, at least until my wife looses it on the garden again (How?!? the orange part is pretty visible against dirt in the garden)>
customer_reviews.author: David_A

customer_reviews.title: Does the job !
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase.....have used many Fiskar products for years and they stand up for their purposed use and they also offer a lifetime guarantee . I used this garden knife to divide hosta plants & daylily plants and it was a breeze ! Well worth the purchase...Highly recommend !!
customer_reviews.author: GinnyL

customer_reviews.title: Fiskar Big Grip Knife
customer_reviews.text: The Fiskar Garden Knife is a sturdy tool. I have used it throughout my half acre garden. The fork tip will pull out weeds and the blade has been used to cut a number of plants, ornamental grasses, and divide my perennial tubers. Would buy again - has a lifetime warranty. Nice addition to my garden tools and gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: LikeGoodValue

customer_reviews.title: Good multi-purpose garden tool.
customer_reviews.text: This has a two-pointed end that I use to poke through landscape matting. The edge can be used like a saw and makes quick work of cutting back grass along a fence line or other similar uses. This is very sturdy and can also be driven into the ground, wiggled back and forth, to make a small hole for a stake, etc. A solid tool that can be used in a variety of ways. Don't know what I did before without it.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Gardener's Weapon
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool; it is extremely effective in manually removing most weeds although I would not recommend trying to pry up scotch thistle. The taproot is just too tough. Get a shovel instead. Also useful in dividing plants when you need to get a bunch of the root, and transplanting as well.
customer_reviews.author: K. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Buy it if you dig alot!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these digging tools. I am a plumber and this is the absolute best tool for digging in tight spots where you need to get into hard soil or clay and dig around in mud. The sharpness gives you extra power to dig and it can cut decent roots with the serrated edge. A must have for any plumbing truck in my opinion!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The Macguyver of the Garden
customer_reviews.text: It slices, it dices, it digs a hole! Well, not really, you have to dig the hole yourself but this thing is a lot better than using your bare hands! It's great for planting small annuals, digging out weeds, and probably a host of other things I haven't tried yet. You should get one.
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: Works for most soil
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for basic gardening needs, great at ripping up roots. I do not live anywhere with hard or clay soil, and have had no problems with it. Good grip and easy to manage. If you are a serious gardener or live somewhere with clay soil, you may need a stronger and more durable tool. However, I think this would fit most people's basic needs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Santos

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy garden knife
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this a couple of days. Compared to my other garden knife, I am not disappointed. It is good for planting and seems that the metal is at least strong enough to deal with some big roots. It comes very nicely packed with a rubber tip over the knife and in a little plastic case. Shipping was super quick.
customer_reviews.author: Maui Beinke

customer_reviews.title: An essential tool in my gardening toolbox
customer_reviews.text: I "accidentally" bought this product 8 or 10 years ago when I really wanted a trowel and there were none left at the store I was at. I ended up loving this tool. It is so versatile. I've given it as a gift to other gardeners who also love it. Wonderful for weeding and working along edging. Sadly, I lost mine a couple weeks ago when I took it to the cemetery to work on a grave. Went back the next day and the tool was gone. I wasted no time ordering another!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite weed digger
customer_reviews.text: This Fiskars brand of weed cutter has been a our favorite. My husband enjoys using this over other types of weed diggers so much, I purchased another one for myself. The design is easy to handle, and sharp enough to get the job done easily.
customer_reviews.author: Missouri

customer_reviews.title: Like a hot knife through butter
customer_reviews.text: Just got around to planting some bulbs I bought last fall. This thing went into the dirt like it was butter! Love it. Easy to handle. After about 100 holes my wrist started to get tired but my hand and grip were never uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Best gardening tool ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is just about my favorite tool for the garden. It's especially useful against thistles. I can slice them out, 4 inches beneath the soil surface and that seems to be killing them well. It's great for weeding or cutting or digging. Love this little monster.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Stahl

customer_reviews.title: A solid investment for the price
customer_reviews.text: It meets my expectations for the price point. It's very solid and While I wish the blade was thinner, it's very sturdy. You can't go wrong for less than $10. I really like the handle, I had purchased a different manufacturer's knife and the handle on that was blocky wood. This is smooth, easy to clean and very comfortable to hold.
customer_reviews.author: VirginianHannah

customer_reviews.title: If I could only have one garden hand tool this would be it.
customer_reviews.text: If I could only have onegarden hand tool this would be it. I bought this one as a gift for my garden helper. I have had mine for several years and still love it. The point cuts tap roots, knife edge cuts them and the serrated edge is like a mini-saw. I wish the entire handle was a neon color so it would be easier to spot when I leave it somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!!
customer_reviews.text: I snapped the first one ( I bought 2 at the same time) in 5 minutes. Got out the 2nd and tried to bend it with my bare hands and it snapped in 2. Tiny spot welds hold the blade to the grip. This is unacceptable Fiskars!
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: This thing is AMAZING. It cuts right through the stem and then ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help with giant elephant ear weeds. This thing is AMAZING. It cuts right through the stem and then pops it right out. I have also used the sides to cut high grasses. On the BIG weeds, this is a must have. Once it is cut and out, you can continue to get the root with the tool. Best garden item I have seen in a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Used for metal detecting
customer_reviews.text: I use this for metal detecting and it has served its purpose. The garden knife is well build and ergonomic. I did manage to slightly bend one of the forks on the end of the blade while I was digging out a large rock. I've dug no telling how many plugs with this knife and it's held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Tex

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: I work on sprinklers for the city parks department and this tool is perfect for cutting the sod around sprinklers. It also helps in loosening up the dirt when I have to remove a broken sprinkler. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: megawatt.mitch

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first use
customer_reviews.text: I would give zero stars, but amazon forces you to give at least one. This literally broke the first time my husband used the garden tool. And of course we can’t return it because we missed the window. Don’t waist your money on this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hori hori.
customer_reviews.text: Great little garden tool with Fiskars quality. I think that this is indestructible. It helps me with all of my gardening work. The only thing that would make it nicer would be to have a sheath so I could keep it on my hip.
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gardening tool, it is sharp enough and tough enough for any weeding work you need to do. It digs, lifts roots, and can cut or chop small tree roots that you come across. I bought one to start with, and have since bought three more.
customer_reviews.author: jaybird

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory for a metal detector
customer_reviews.text: I bought this garden knife to use with my metal detector. It does a great job cutting grass plugs! I actually purchased a garden knife costing 3 times more and this one works better. The handle is more comfortable in the hand and the larger serration cut through grass roots quickly. The only downside is the lack of a sheath. Fortunately I had some leather laying around and I made one for the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: WOW..
customer_reviews.text: I'm asking myself, what took me so long to aquire this tool in my collection. It's great for slicing through clay soil, roots, uprooting weeds and even cutting a stay limb or two. I even used it to augment the use of my hand edger to edge around the base of trees where hardened clay and thick grass roots sometimes impeded my progress. A useful and inexpensive purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable knife
customer_reviews.text: Puuurty dern gud. I use this thing like a woodpecker uses it's beak. I stab weeds, stab hard clay, cut through roots, prune cactus, and stab more dirt. If I try real hard, I can bend it outta shape. My first one lasted me two years before it snapped in half. I always have several knives as I use it for so many things.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower Healing

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the concept of having a handy knife to opening ...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the concept of having a handy knife to opening bags of soil and other gardening products, but this thing is dull. I'm not sure if it's going to be useful at all. Tried to open a bag of soil with it--had to go get out my big Olfa scissors. Doesn't look like it could be sharpened either. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Caryl

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive metal detecting option
customer_reviews.text: Did not want to spend a fortune on a digging tool for metal detecting right now & did not want to wait (Amazon ships so fast) Works great do far. Heavy. It's Fiskar, so it should last. Cuts sod well. Grip is comfy. Guard is a nice size. Yeah, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron D. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: A Must for the Gardener
customer_reviews.text: Best weeder my husband has EVER used. The local garden supply shop has gone out of business, but Amazon has everything I need in one convenient place AND delivered free to my house with Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: traveler

customer_reviews.title: Best garden knife🌻
customer_reviews.text: Great garden tool!! Very sturdy and easy to handle “ergonomic”. I’ve used it to pull weeds and plant bulbs and seedlings. Loosening clay soil is so easy with this garden knife.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah B

customer_reviews.title: My new go to garden too thats goes everywhere with me
customer_reviews.text: I freaking LOVE this thing! It digs, it cuts, it weeds, and scoops. This garden knife is to gardeners what a Samurai sword is to a ninja. Its sharp but not dangerous like a samurai sword. Iy has sometype of coating in the metal too so I don't think I'll see it rusting. I think I'll order another one eventually so I always have one near.
customer_reviews.author: ALB

customer_reviews.title: A Necessity for Every Gardener!
customer_reviews.text: I recently lost (?) this exact garden knife/ transplanting tool. I looked everywhere and since I use it all the time, I simply had to buy another one! My local stores were no longer selling this seasonal item. It was a relief to find it on Amazon at a reasonable price. The item arrived in three days and I used it, that day! You can’t top Fiskars brand and I’m very pleased with the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Gerd

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I had this for about a month before it snapped in half where the blade meets the handle. Shame on you, Fiskars, for not living up to the standards you make your scissors to.
customer_reviews.author: Katushya

customer_reviews.title: Valuable Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: What a versatile tool. With a holster, it is so handy to have when gardening. It is a knife, saw, weeder, digger at the least. Much handier than having 5 different tools in hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: I used this in hard ground and the handle broke off after very little use. I was surprised because I consider Fiskars to be a trusted brand, I have used their scissors for years.
customer_reviews.author: Ina Saltz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Handle and Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Fiskars Garden Knife (I still have the other 2. I just like buying and keeping spares). This tool makes it easier to remove the weeds (dandelions) from my garden without breaking off the roots. Has a very comfortable handle.
customer_reviews.author: Vic L.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool. I bought this instead of the more expensive ones because I loose my tools too frequently. No regrets. I went and dug a bunch of dandelions out really easily. I pushed and pulled really hard on it and there were no bends or cracks to be had. I gave 1 star off because I think the handle is a bit too short. But I am really glad I have it.
customer_reviews.author: GJ

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. The second time I used this tool for weeding (in soft, well-worked soil) it snapped right in half. I do like how it works so much that I've still been weeding with it, just holding the blade part with a gloved hand. I'll be on the search for a higher quality version of this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Use it all the time finally broke at the handle but Fiskars warrantee is sending me a new one. Great company , good value, they stand behind their products and make a good product. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ke

customer_reviews.title: OK, but could be better - not for metal detecting
customer_reviews.text: Got this for metal detecting it didn't last me that long the top handle broke off. It did feel like quality material and sturdy at first, but eventually started bending and eventually the handle broke. I would not recommend for metal detecting it can't handle the stress, if dealing with different types of soils, specially really dry or wet.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Using it for metal detecting.
customer_reviews.text: For my needs, and because I didn't want to spend 35 dollars on a Branded digger, This is a solid choice.Its taken a beating in the rocky soils of N.E.and looks no worse for wear. Cuts are nice and quick. and it cost a fraction of similar knives. That said. It isn't set back like the big boys are so it losses some of it's scooping potential. Also no sheath.
customer_reviews.author: B Sauce

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in the summer and used it for all my gardening this year. It is strong, reliable and has really made my gardening faster and easier. The only downside is the lack of a sheath. I recommend this to anyone who has a lot of digging is root bound soil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My new fave gardening tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool is indispensable for weeding, digging, planting. I keep it handy anytime I work in the garden and it is now my go-to tool for many situations.
customer_reviews.author: Donna G. James

customer_reviews.title: Necessary tool for the garden
customer_reviews.text: The best purchase of a utensil that I make for my garden. Very good for digging in the hard and compact soil I have. It is a bit heavy, so you have to be careful to do some delicate work like removing plants from plastic pots. I love this tool, I am thinking of buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Demianch

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but not for digging.
customer_reviews.text: I like Fiskars tools and they make great gardening tools but this digging tool/knife was just not comfortable to dig with. It's more of a knife tool for garden then digging. Its sturdy and strong but just doesnt work well for digging.
customer_reviews.author: Dan&Val

customer_reviews.title: Broke before it even got dirty.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on February 10th from Amazon. Received the tool, removed the tip guard, and on the first dig into the ground the handle completely broke off. The blade does not continue into the handle like most knives or hand tools. Instead 4 tiny spot welds bind the blade to a cross-shaped piece of metal in the handle. These spot welds broke on first use. We've contacted Fiskars for a replacement, but I would highly advise anyone to avoid purchasing this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Tidwell Longbottom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fine, but not worth looking.
customer_reviews.text: If there's one indispensible tool, it's a toothed garden knife. This one by Fiskars--and I always trusted that brand--have the advantage of having an orange-tipped handle. That makes it easier to find it in the garden. But the blade detacted from the handles, like a perforated pop-off. Look for a knife that has a stainless steel shaft that runs all the way through the handle. And I bought 2 of these! Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Wordspecs

customer_reviews.title: Must have item for every Gardner
customer_reviews.text: Best addition to my gardening tool set. Was advise by a local landscape architect to buy one and wished I had known about this tool long ago .....
customer_reviews.author: bcmayo

customer_reviews.title: Decent tool
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars tools just aren't made the way they used to be but this is handy for digging in the garden when you don't need a shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Horton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: Use caution around children as this is Very sharp! Love it though for my garden. I can dig, cut, slice, and twist into things with this Garden knife. Recommend keeping in the plastic sheets for safety and to keep it from rubbing other tools dulling it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Understood

customer_reviews.title: Now my go to garden tool.
customer_reviews.text: Wonder what I ever did without this little tool. Sturdy, sharp, and long to get out roots. I use it for everything in the garden. I expected nothing less from Fiskars. Love their quality.
customer_reviews.author: brenda

customer_reviews.title: Even at this price - it is not worth it. Get a better tool.
customer_reviews.text: I agree with some other comments - the handle is weak! Overall, this is a very useful tool, but whenever you apply even moderate pressure to the handle you feel it give way and bend, If you need a sturdy tool - this is not it. The low price of this item does not justify its flimsiness. I got myself steel Japanese garden knife instead.
customer_reviews.author: Gai Elhanan MD

customer_reviews.title: Handy, quality gardening tool
customer_reviews.text: I garden alot...from a huge flower garden, to ferns in the woods. I have always had very good luck with the Fiskers garden tools and this one rates right up there as a serious, good tool. It is sharp,,,,does the job when you come to a root or something that needs cutting. I did a lot of gardening this year and this was always in my most important tools bucket that I carry as I move from one area to another. Word of caution... this is a knife, it is sharp and as with all knives, etc. keep out of reach of kids. I think every serious gardener needs this in their tools.
customer_reviews.author: Gaely

customer_reviews.title: So far this garden tool has been great
customer_reviews.text: This tool is working as described, great in the garden for weeding, planting. It feels good in the hand for long periods of time. Would definitely purchase this again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: This is great! It gets deep down on the hard weeds. If the weed is too stubborn, the serrated blade cuts it off well below the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Linda F

customer_reviews.title: Gardening tool AND self defense all in one!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite gardening tool ever. I can cut through smaller tree roots and dig holes for my bulbs with ease. Would love a leather sheath to wear this on my hip for easy self-defense. You think I'm kidding? I'm not kidding. This thing is AWESOME!!! #zombieapocalypse
customer_reviews.author: Lip Gloss Junkie

customer_reviews.title: It was wonderful while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: The handle broke on me about 3-6 months after getting it. I don’t quite remember when. I thought it would be super sturdy, but... it wasn’t. I used them for collecting wild plants. I also kept it in my car so my wife would feel a little safer (lol).
customer_reviews.author: n@han.A

customer_reviews.title: Broke Within a Week
customer_reviews.text: Normally I have pretty good luck with amazon products and tend to ignore a lot of the negative reviews. That was my mistake. After just about a week of using. The blade snapped of from the handle. Of course it is just a 9 dollar tool, but if your going tk be digging in the soil, (not much, sand, etc.) then spend the few extra bucks and get a Lesche or Garret tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: BLADE WELDED TO HANDLE FAILS EASILY
customer_reviews.text: CHEAP METAL WELDED TO HANDLE, NOT ONE PIECE. ONLY BUY ONE PIECE, THIS WILL BREAK FIRST DAY. BLADE BENDS, WELDS FAIL.
customer_reviews.author: YeshuaMessiah

customer_reviews.title: it broke
customer_reviews.text: yes, I read the reviews, saw pictures of broken tools, but the price was good, so I decided that I'm not strong enough to brake it. Well - it broke - exactly the same way the other tools from negative reviews did and without any special force applied - I was just digging the dirt...
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Sorry to Say...I didn't like it !
customer_reviews.text: I tried to like it as the price was good...But the blade was dull, the serrated side just tore everything up. I returned it...
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Habbyshaw

customer_reviews.title: The handle is comfortable and the serrated edge cuts through roots
customer_reviews.text: I use it for finding the hole in gopher mounds so I can insert the traps. It works well for that purpose. The handle is comfortable and the serrated edge cuts through roots.
customer_reviews.author: Cheapo

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and robus product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product to use as a hori digging knife. the serrated edge effectively cuts of roots in the digging process. I use it as a planter tool along with a home-made soil scoop. Email me if you want to learn more about the soil scoop.
customer_reviews.author: Ramachandran Bala

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars 7079 Big Grip Garden Knife
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Fiskars Big Grip Garden Knife to add to the bucket of go to garden tools. It is a strong tool which combines knife, saw, weeder and spade into one tool. The heavy galvanized coating and heavy rubber tool handle with a cord strap to hang, is as good as I have. I refuse to buy expensive garden tools, as almost any tool can be used to do most work. Even a claw hammer as needed to dig out a hole. This tool is probably the best of all worlds. It should last the life of your desire to do gardening. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: CDP's Onceagain habit of purchasingTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Broke first use!
customer_reviews.text: Pure junk. Used it for 10 minutes metal detecting, tried to move a tiny rock out of the way and it snapped at the handle. It's a metal blade, super glued to a plastic handle.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Rambo Gardening
customer_reviews.text: I find that this is more than a weed yanker. It’s good for bed prep and plantings. Problems reported with bending I was mindful of but didn’t experience that. You do have to be careful with taking too deep of a bite in the ground but that applies to most tools.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Wigzell

customer_reviews.title: Great for weeding, but like to play hide-and-seek
customer_reviews.text: Second time buying this item. I love that my spouse does yard work, but not that he loses track of the tools! This is a great one ... if I hide it.
customer_reviews.author: RobandDiane

customer_reviews.title: Now this is a sweet tool that you would name “Handy”.
customer_reviews.text: I have fallen in love with this Fiskars tool! I straw-bale garden and it’s just the tool to punch into those bales for planting. Very comfortable grip.
customer_reviews.author: jtb4jesus

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Broke in half the first time I used it. I have used Fiskars for many years and this is the first time this has happened with one of their products.
customer_reviews.author: DEBBIE

product_meta.title: Fiskars Big Grip Garden Knife (70796935J)
product_meta.description:
Size:Pack 1The Big Grip Garden Knife reduces hand fatigue whether you’re slicing through sod, digging out dandelions, opening bags of soil, planting or transplanting. An extra-large handle with a soft-molded grip provides excellent control and comfort, and the cast-aluminum head resists rust and won’t snap off while you’re digging. A sharpened blade with a serrated edge makes it easy to dig into tough soil. Additionally, the handle features a hang hole for convenient storage.

AMAZON.COM
The Fiskars big grip garden knife features a comfortable grip and an oversized tool head to provide added comfort and control. The garden knife is an ideal choice for digging, planting, weeding, and transplanting. It sports a serrated edge on one side to cut through tough roots and a straight blade on the other side ideal for digging. The pre-sharpened edges are designed to cut through the ground easier. The middle of the blade has a trough-like indention for transplanting soil or seeds, and has a notched tip at the end to remove weeds. The metal blade is also coated with a rust-resistant material, and the handle features a large hang hole for easy storage. The tool comes with a limited lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: Ideal for a variety of garden tasks, from digging to opening bags
Padded, oversized handle provides exceptional grip and comfortable use
Polished cast-aluminum head resists rust and won’t bend or break while digging
Sharpened blade with serrated edge makes carving into hard ground easy

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,344 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
